name: Trump International Hotel Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great and loved the piano bar in the evening. I actually liked not having the casino right there..no smoke :) You can easily get to the strip by walking through the mall that is across the street from the Trump. The rooms were really nice. I heard the train a couple times but not bad..then again we were on the 19th floor. I didn't like that you had to pay for internet service $5.95 to print out your airline tickets from the business center!
reviews.title: Great hotel if you don't mind no casino and just off the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well some people mentioned the train and yes it does go by a few times in the middle of the night. We stayed on the 51st floor and the noise was very noticeable. The reason it sounds so loud is that the window vents don't close properly and there is no insulation to dampen the noise coming in, so yes the helicopters, cars and train come through like they are in your room. The location is a bit off the strip, but plenty of shuttles and the walk does you good after big meals. There is a very good mall across the street with lots of good stores, a food court for snacks, and is a great cut though to the strip as well. Staff are very good, courteous, helpful and fun. If they could fix their one problem (noise coming into the room), the Hotel would be a great deal it would be a four star at least, very clean through out.
reviews.title: Damn Train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: #1. location: 200 feet from rail road. woke me up 6 times during the night. switched room the next day to strip view, didn't help at all.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE - should be rated 1 (ONE) STAR.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: #2. checked in, pillow still has lipstick and stains all over.
reviews.title: Largest bath tub i've / we've been in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: #3. bathtub still has pubic hair in it
reviews.title: What a wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received this hotel on a Hotwire purchase. So we got a great price. I am so happy that we stayed there. It is an amazing hotel. Cant think of anything negative at all to say. It is a great place to come 'home' to after a day out in the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. This non-smoking, casino-free hotel was perfect for us!
reviews.title: Great Stay at a Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival: We arrived shortly after midnight on a Thursday night. Pulled up and a very friendly valet person greeted us, and helped us load our stuff onto a cart. Then we walked in the hotel - it smelled great! They have lots of fresh flowers around, and perhaps that is why. I loved the decor of the lobby area. Classy, and clean. Very pretty. There were 4 groups ahead of us checking in. We had to wait about 10 minutes until our turn. We had a great experience checking in. Anthony was very helpful and kind. He explained everything to us, found us a really nice location/room, and even walked us around the lobby area and showed us where everything was. He went over and above in my opinion. We were off to a good start. Express elevator to floor 43.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room:
reviews.title: Always The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: They have man trap doors, which is a term I learned about that night. It has one door for 2 rooms. Then a little entry area, with an entrance for each room. I was very impressed with the room. It was gorgeous! We were told these were originally going to be sold as condos, so the rooms are actually condo style. Ours was a studio. Had a wall of cabinets and shelves, and a kitchenette. Microwave, frig, stovetop, sink - lots of storage. Everything was decorated very nice. It was a good size room. There was a living area, with a sofabed (we did not use it), a desk, and table. Then the King size bed (a little soft for our taste, but the sheets were crisp and clean, and a variety of pillows to choose from, and a couple end tables. The best part was the bathroom. It was huge! Beautiful floors, a jacuzzi tub, a glass enclosed shower with an incredibly high shower head, and separate toilet area. Then a large vanity/sink with plenty of counter space and drawers for all your stuff. The mirror had a built-in tv in it - odd, but neat. Our view was of the strip and the Fashion Show mall area. Really nice!
reviews.title: Best Value at the Trump
Per arrival service poor
reviews.text: Service: every single person we encountered were friendly and helpful. We really thought they each gave an extra little bit to everything they did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is difficult to find something wrong with a first class hotel..My wife and I stayed for four nights at the Trump in Las Vegas to get away from the smoke and beer smell associated with some of the properties on the strip...We were not disapointed.. We had a corner one bedroom strip view on the 52nd floor. The only sounds we heard were the faint whistle of the passing freight train and the occasional sirens. The suite was pure luxury with three TVs and a master bathroom (there was two) larger then my last hotel room in Tokyo...Marble floors, huge windows including a window above the oversize jet tub...No hallway noise at all. The staff very accomodating..The insuite food service superb..The shuttle goes every 15 minutes to the Wynn or to the the Forum on the strip..It was great...We will stay there again if in Vegas...
reviews.title: The luxury of Trump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: The hotel was nicely appointed. Elegant, modern decor in the rooms, great bathroom with jetted tub and an awesome tv in the mirror! Front desk staff was great! Helpful, friendly. The restaurant didn't measure up to the overall experience of the hotel. We went for dinner after checking in, it wasn't busy. We were seated and placed our orders but waited 30-40 minutes for the meal! I ordered fish and chips and my colleague ordered the grilled chicken sandwich. She only ate the chicken on half of her sandwich and described it as "gross". My fish wasn't seasoned and was disgusting. We ate the fries and called it a night. Mr. Trump needs to take a look at what's happening in that kitchen. If he would have been there that night I'm sure someone would've heard....You're Fired!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel....Horrible Restaurant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at this hotel for 3 nights towards the end of our trip in Vegas and were rather surprised by how wonderful this place ended up being. It was because of the reviews here that I even noticed the place and the Trump LV lived up to those reviews.
reviews.title: Amazing, Cheerful Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Staff: The staff was beyond helpful and nice for us. Those at the check-in were even more helpful and made the process run very smooth from the get-go. I asked for a higher room level and one that faced the strip and the receptionist was glad to obliged the request. I spoke with the concierge a few times, but every time we were there they seemed to be busy and we didn't hang around long. The staff handling the valet were really great and started to remember us.
reviews.title: Elegant, non smoking, close to everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room: Oh, we loved this room. I have stayed at many various hotels in LV, just to compare and contrast what they offer, and I really enjoyed the details and layout of this room. The only thing that I thought was goofy about the design was the shared entry way for the room next to you. The noise coming from the other room was a bit distracting, but other than that we loved this mini-loft. The bed was extremely comfy and I found it kind of hard to get out of bed because I was so comfortable. The design of the room was classy and had just enough to have a "minimalist-conservative" feel and flow. We used the little kitchen area a number of times on this stay, so that was handy and helpful. I also really liked all the closet space offered. My husband had his own area to mess up and I was able to keep my area clean.
reviews.title: Trumparific
Understaffed and under par
reviews.text: Am in Vegas frequently for meetings and tried this spot for first time as I have had great hotel stays at Trump in Chicago and was ready to have a smoke-free, casino-free experience. I hated it. The good is the lobby is quiet and small and you can access elevators quickly and quietly; the rooms are lovely; the staff is lovely. HOWEVER, the hotel is seriously understaffed. While waiting for my room to be ready, I tried having lunch in the only casual eatery in the hotel, but 4 of 7 waitstaff did not show up that day so it took an hour and a half for my tuna salad to arrive; when I mentioned this to some of the hotel personnel they admitted there was real staffing issue; when I ordered room service coffee it took 3 attempts for them to get my milk order right; the elevators are very slow; the spa did not have someone to fill up the water jugs or pick up used towels; at times there was no one in front to manage the taxi line. And so on. I would never stay here again. Back to the big beautiful places for me!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Trump International in Las Vegas in September of 2011 for the IndyCar race. Just now getting a minute to review. We wanted everyone to know how fabulous this place is. Exactly what we'd expect from this chain. Our view from the room alone was worth staying. We would come back after a day out and sit on the sofa (which we turned around to face the window) and have a drink and just look out at the strip. Fantastic. Everyone that works there is totally personable. Our dinner there was superb and we had an equally superb waiter. We did love that you don't have to walk through a smokey casino to get to your room. The pool was very, very nice..service there was great as well. Anything we asked for, we received promptly. I liked the security as well, you don't get into the elevator without showing your room key. People talk about the trains but we hardly heard them. I felt elegant the whole trip just being there, even when we came back from the track a bit icky. Great time, we will be back!
reviews.title: Total Class, Mr. Trump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in strip view suite for 4 days over Easter and had a fabulous time.. Some may think the location just off the strip is not desirable, we thought is was a great location just a short walk from the strip.
reviews.title: Great 5 star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the chandeliers in the drive up entrance to the TV in the mirror of the bathroom this place was all class. Everything in the room was great, bedding, kitchen, bathroom could not fault any aspect. A great view looking straight up the strip from our 49th floor suite.
reviews.title: Great stay, serene, close enough to strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dined in the restaurant on 2 occassions and really enjoyed our meals each time.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed in the Trumph Hotel in Vegas. Hotel Staff very courtious and helpful, breakfast each morning were terrific. Reception staff the most helpful we have seen for a long time.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel because of one salient feature we ADORE: their check-out time is 4 p.m.! It's so wonderful to be able to get up late and not have to worry about packing suitcases the night before, it's like having an extra vacation day- awesome! From now on, this is my favorite hotel in Vegas!
reviews.title: Treated like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Their service is nothing short of excellent. Upon arrival, there were only a couple of people in line waiting to check in, versus the typical long wait elsewhere. Every single time we encountered an employee in the elevator, they politely asked if we were enjoying our stay and if we needed anything else.
reviews.title: As close to a decent business hotel as you're going to find in Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The accomodations themselves are beautiful and spacious ( see pictures ).They have a nice kitchen with a Sub-zero mini-fridge, a microwave, a sink and cutlery and dishes, but if you decide to eat-in with room service you are in for a real treat : they come in with the white tablecloth and napkins and set you up with your meal with actual butter on an actual plate ( no foil-wrapped airline packages here, baby!) and make you feel like you're in a Hollywood movie. The gratuity is included on the bill, but we liked our server so much, we gave him an extra tip.
reviews.title: I LOVED & ENJOYED MY STAY!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually buy our show tickets before coming to Vegas and arrange our stay around them. This time we hadn't , but our delightful concièrge, Frederic , obtained our tickets for LOVE for us and got us the prices for Le Rêve, so we could see if it was worth getting them at the discounted ticket kiosk accross the street at the Fashion Show mall.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just off the Vegas Strip and across the street from Fashion Show Mall is Trump Las Vegas. This is a great hotel if you want a cool place to stay but don't like walking through a smokey casino to get to your tower room. The loby looks like a palace and the rooms are modern, sleak and ultra comfortable. There is even a small kitchenet in the studio rooms. The hotels are set back off the hallways which helps cut down any noise. The pool area is small but has an exclusive feel. Don't expect waterfalls and lazy rivers. Trump is a short walk to Las Vegas Blvd. and Wynn Las Vegas. Go to Trump if you want a quality modern room and don't mind the lack of gaming.
reviews.title: Great Hotel to Escape the Smokey Casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at That hôtel for 3 nights. Nice big room with kitchenette , fridge
reviews.title: TRUMP HOTEL in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: King bed, feader pillows. Not too far from the strip about 10mn walk. Near
reviews.title: Great hotel and great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Whynn hotel.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Be aware that the hôtel charge $25 per night for Internet and shuttle, even
reviews.title: A luxurious stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: One of the most beautiful and luxurious hotel I have ever seen in all my life
reviews.title: simply PERFECT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All was perfect: the hall full of perfume, the receptionists, the relaxing athmosphere, the marvellous room, the funny swimming pool, the gym...
reviews.title: Best stay ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the bed was so huge and comfortable!
reviews.title: I would come back to Trump Tower Hotel but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lot of hotels in Las Vegas are kitsch: too many marms, too many gold things, too many lights and sounds...
reviews.title: Great value, but location could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was simple but very elegant...quiet (because there is no casino inside the hotel) and charming
reviews.title: The latest and one of the best of Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here May 17-21. Hotel staff was very professional and courteous. Hotel smells great, no smoking is great. Asked for a strip view and got a room on the 48th floor with an awesome view of the strip. Call ahead for your car if you are doing the valet parking and it will save you some time. Short walk(10 minutes) to the strip. Elevator is fast. Did hear the train a couple of times but wasn't really a big deal, went right back to sleep. We actually did this trip through Hotwire, so this was a really good value. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Trump in Las Vegas and was impressed with the hotel. It's a different Las Vegas experience than most, mainly because it is off the strip and doesn't have a casino. Depending on your preference this may be a good or bad thing. I found it refreshingly quiet and non-chaotic, but I was there for business at the MGM so had to do some walking. The hotel is beautiful inside and out. My room was very nice, but showing it's age a bit. The bathroom was the best feature, with a large tub and shower, and a television in the mirror. Some of the furniture had dents and scratches, and the chair in the room had a loose arm that was literally falling off. I used the on site gym, which was small but functional.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, showing its age...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: As I said the hotel does not have a casino. While I was fine with this it also meant my food choices were very limited. I had room service (which was very expensive), the one restaurant (which was equally expensive), or a walk over to the strip for restaurants.
reviews.title: Truly a Trump Card

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Trump is an excellent choice for you if you prefer to be away from the strip and aren't much of a gambler. It's surrounded on all sides by empty lots, and foot and vehicle traffic near it are at a minimum.
reviews.title: Average hotel, we expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: When in Fabulous Las Vegas next and looking for a change of pace, try the Trump International Hotel just off the north end of the strip. I just enjoyed 4 glorious days there and am having a hard time coming up with much to warn you about (haha). Check in/out was seamless & the staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable. The lobby is open, bright and very nice including the lobby lounge. I'm sure I had just a standard room, but the size, detail and cleanliness were amazing. Just the woodwork - an entire wall of casework - was beautiful. Although I didn't use it much, the kitchen features (small cook top, nice sized fridge, sink, a few kitchen items (corkscrew!!) were a nice addition. The bathroom was large, lovely and very well lit by Vegas standards! Housekeeping did a GREAT job getting to our room early & having everything stocked. The BEST part (for me anyway) was the proximity of the pool!!! No 20 minute hike to the pool (like many LV hotels) here! Get out on 2 and Voila...there's the pool! Nothing fancy - no "lazy river" or tricky shape - but large enough & great for lap swimming early! Service at the pool was a bit slow and unpredictable, and the drink prices were typical Las Vegas (high), but the FOOD at the pool cafe/deckside was REALLY good and the prices were so reasonable (that is NOT a sign to raise them, Mr. Trump!!). No kidding, the salads were beautiful and huge and fresh, the snacks were great, the sandwiches looked delish.....and all of it was priced like anywhere else for the same thing....even here in Indy! There is a Happy Hour in the lobby (I think every evening) with nice drink and appetizer specials....and the lounge is very comfy & nice (live jazz the evening we were there). Did not eat breakfast in the restaurant, but did stop in for dessert late one night. The decor is lovely, but cannot vouch for the food/service/price. As others have mentioned, there is a free shuttle to Wynn & Forum Shops @ Caesars which is really nice! We never waited for more than a couple of minutes....but for those who don't want to wait, cabs are plentiful! Overall, a really nice, relaxing experience in a hotel that is classy and of manageable size! Thanks, everybody at Trump!
reviews.title: Not Quite Up to Par

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there from Wednesday, April 28 to Sunday, May 2. We were on the 45th floor, south view of strip, one bedroom suite for a steal. It was one of the nicest places we have ever stayed at. Two full bathrooms, one of which was a huge master bathroom, a plasma HD TV in bedroom and one in living room and small plasma HD Tv in the mirror in master bathroom, very comfortable bed, we asked for feather pillows and they were there , full kitchen. Newspaper delivery of two papers, a different one for each of us per our request. The place is top of line first class all the way, excellent responsive customer service, great location - directly across street from the Fashion Show Mall (I could see Nordstroms from our window), a short walk to Wynn and strip. Smoke free, no casino. Fast elevators, no wait. Fabulous large gym, great equipment including a rowing machine. They had a free shuttle running on the half hour roundtrips from hotel to Caesar's and even let us off at the Wynn. We had done a lot of walking and our feet really hurt so the free shuttle was a great convenience. Our room was very quiet, no noise. We'll be back again this year. Can't wait! We did not eat at the restaurant,we never eat where we stay. We could live here it was so nice and comfortable, great furniture and spacious. It was perfect and beyond our expectations. I would say it is just as nice as a Four Seasons at 25% of the price.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the resort and internet fees - totally bunk. It was way too cool and windy to use the pool and paying $12 a day for internet - come on, why???? Nice room, great hot tub and amenities. We had a good stay for our first time in Vegas, but if we return, we'll look for something else.
reviews.title: Quite Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: WOW! My young family and I were not sure what to expect when we arrived (Having bid for our room on priceline). But we were not dissapointed!
reviews.title: I Love This Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were overwhelmed by the opulant foyer and the extremely attentive staff. We were given adjacent rooms which shared one main front door and had an inner lobby (absolutely perfect for larger families), the rooms/suites were incredible, huge open plan living bedroom, full high quality kitchen, complimentary water, top class coffee, giant fluffy bathrobes, enormous bed, ipod docking station etc etc and then the bathroom....Larger than some hotel rooms, the jacussi bath was big enough for at least 2, the seperate glass screened toilet complete with telephone allowed privacy, the shower cubicle larger than most UK bathrooms. The icing on the cake - The TV in the bathroom mirror! My children were in heaven!
reviews.title: Trump - You Are Fired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant (although we didnt try it) seemed to be very good value, the room service which we did try, was no more expensive than alot of Vegas restaurants, and was the perfect treat to end a very busy day!
reviews.title: Good hotel, but there are much better places to stay in Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I wrote reviews on several hotels in Las Vegas but The Trump is still my favorite.1st class hotel with 1st class treatment of thier guess..If you ask for something, most likely you will recieve it. A five star hotel with five star employees.
reviews.title: Love The Trump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is definitely 5 star quality. Location is not great, a fairly long walk to Casinos on the strip. The property does not have a Casino, so if you are looking to play in the casino, this is not the place for you. Beware of the "surprise" $28 resort fee on top of the room cost. In other words if your room rate does not indicate that the resort fee is included, count on paying an additinal $28.When we were checking in we were informed of this, however when we were checking out, we overheard couple of guests asking what the additional $28 was for. We were told the resort fee covered shuttles to the Wynn Hotel and Caesar's Palace and a credit to the spa. The guest next to me at check out questioned the fee and when told it covered shuttles, he said, well, at least i can use it to get to the airport, but was told it didn't cover that shuttle.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - No Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Recently stayed 4 nights at the Trump International in Las Vegas and was delighted. I am not a gambler and the fact that this location did not have a casino was perfect for me.
reviews.title: Not a Fan of Trump but His Hotel is Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were luxurious. I booked a corner suite but, due to noise issues, (room was overlooking train tracks and freight trains passed in the night with horns blaring) was moved up to a penthouse suite which was unbelievable.
reviews.title: Nice view in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I did not dine at DJT, but the bar/lounge was very comfortable and the service was excellent.
reviews.title: Just off the strip, but well worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for four nights during a recent visit to Vegas. It was nice to stay in a hotel that was just a hotel and where there was no smoking allowed.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The suite we stayed in was huge, the pool and gym facilities were great. Although the hotel isnt on the strip the free shuttle bus ensured that it was easy to get around.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would stay here again
reviews.title: Trump does it right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: "This was the nicest room I've ever stayed in. The bed and pillows were awesome. Slept like a baby. Everything was High End... even the drawers were self closing. I loved that it was non gaming. A nice quiet escape from the casinos. Just a walk across the street would get you into the fashion Mall. The valet parking was great and the staff was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
An oasis of calm amidst the "chaos" that is Las vegas!
reviews.text: The only con would be that they were completely booked and ran out of extra towels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made this reservation March, 2011 for our anniversary and my hubby's birthday thru Expedia. Bought voucher for Bell Transportation to shuttle you to/from hotel..worked out perfectly. Check in at hotel was just as we expected and we were upgraded to next level suite. We live in rural AZ with trains passing thru city so train horns don't bother us (ha). Room was excellent and the mattress does need to be replaced. Housekeeping was right up to par...I always bring little items (nail polish, lipstick) to leave with a few dollars each morning for housekeeper. Nice gesture. Bathroom TV was great. We ate at DJT Restaurant twice. Food and service was excellent. Prices and variety of entrees were very reasonable for Vegas. Had breakfast each day there - buffet if you wanted it - we ate off menu and again food was perfect. The lobby bar has some great bartenders...from 5-7PM daily happy hour...best deal in town...well drinks, wine, beer and nice selection of finger food available for $5. After that the prices go up and a very poor pour - we always stopped for a night cap. We understand new bar mgt. has instituted pour changes and that's why no one is at the bar after 7PM. The hotel shuttle is great....runs every 15 mins. to Wynn and Caesar's and returns you back to Trump...disappointing how many folks on shuttle stiff the driver. These folks depend on tips...come on folks. We had a minor problem with room and hotel manager handled it immediately. We had a wonderful five days at Trump. Will be returning Thanksgiving Week.
reviews.title: Everything We Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, but unfortunately they failed to inform me and the wife of the very annoying train that sounds its horn through the early hours.
reviews.title: Welcome to the Trump Train Hotel Experiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: When I complained they tried to make the excuse that it effects all the strip hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you are a sound sleeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NOPE don't think it does Mr Manager! Been going to Vegas for many years had no trouble with the others. So please don't make these poor excuses up.
reviews.title: Nice property......but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You may be sorry to hear about our stay and all the 100s of $$s we spent on sleepiness nights at the hotel, but I see no refund, no warning about placing the hotel on the side of the train crossing on your website.
reviews.title: Not as Good as Expected...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a corner suite, price was pretty good, considering the spacious room, huge bathroom, bedroom, and full kitchen. Lots of small things added to the overall positive experience-soft close toilet seats, free in room internet, jacuzzi tub, 2 bathroom sinks, TV screen in the bathroom mirror(pretty cool, but we didn't use it). Not to mention the excellent telephone reservation experience that I had: we were flying in to Vegas at 9 am, staying 1 night at the Trump, then going on to stay with a wedding party at different hotel the next day. We were told that the room would be ready for us at 9 am, and without asking, offered 4pm late checkout the following day-amazing!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some confusion at checkin regarding the reservation, but it was handled smoothly and professionally, and without attitude.
reviews.title: An oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. The only down side is that it is at the north end of the strip, so you need to do some walking to get anywhere. However, if you like shopping, you can enter an excellent mall through Nordstrom's, across the street.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Friendly, well managed, clean, and non-chaotic in the heart of Las Vegas
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Trump three nights in April when we came to Vegas for our baby moon. We would definitely stay here again. We loved that it was non-smoking. The lobby was never packed. The pool was never too busy and was very relaxing with really attentive service. The rooms are lavish and comfortable. We could not hear the train from our room even though we had the city view suite. The hotel is a short walk to the strip, but there was also a free shuttle that went back and forth from the Wynn every 15 minutes. Our only problem was that someone charged drinks to our room one night, but the hotel was pretty prompt about taking off the charge. If you are looking for a hotel that offers a relaxing experience but is also close to the fun of the strip, I would definitely recommend this one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from April 26-29. I had my yorkie with me so thats why I choose this hotel. It is pet friendly. My city view suite was awesome. Room was clean and neat. Bathroom was huge. Hotel is located right across the street from Fashion Show Mall which was very convenient. The hotel is also about a 5 minute walk to the Wynn. They also provide a shuttle to the Forum Shops which is about Mid strip so you can walk around there. All the hotel staff were very friendly. Check in and check out were quick and easy. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Classy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I doubt if we shall ever get back to Las Vegas, but I would think this the best for we seniors who are still quite active.
reviews.title: Lo Mejor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live at 6700 ft and walk lots.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On 1 May, we stayed in 5205; on 6 and 7 May, we stayed in 3112.
reviews.title: Wonderful until unbelievably rude concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The higher floor was way better.
reviews.title: Luxurious Sanctuary For a Great Price!
Great Service & a Beautiful Room
reviews.text: Only a New Yorker would find a concierge rude!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you want to go to Vegas but you don't want to feel like a sardine in a can, pick Trump International. It is about 1 block off of the Strip across the street from Fashion Show Mall, Wynn Hotel and Encore Hotel. You'll experience a clean hotel with extremely friendly staff but with less "partying" and noise like some of the other Strip hotels. My husband and I would walk about 2 blocks to get to the Deuce buses to travel up and down the Strip when we wanted to see the sights. Rooms are large with marble bathrooms, jacuzzi tubs, shower stalls and floor to ceiling windows. But be prepared to spend a little money. Although I got a great room deal ($500 for a Sat-Wed stay), they do tack on a daily fee for use of the pool/spa/health club, a resort tax, and room service can be a bit expensive with the delivery charge and 20% gratuity that are automatically added on. You are better off just going downstairs to the restaurant to eat. Other than that, we had a really nice stay and would definitely pick another Trump hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Nice quiet hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There were three of us using the room, so it was necessary for us to use the pull out bed. When it was opened, it had dirty linen on the mattress. Also, the bath tub was nasty. There was body hair in it, and it felt as if it had only been wiped out. I called Housekeeping and they came rather quickly to change sheets and clean tub. It would have been nice if there were pots and pans to use on the stove. Not sure, but it looked like an induction stove, and regular pots won't work on those. Room was beautiful, but didn't get the Luxury Hotel fee at all. All we got was a newspaper everyday, but I could have gotten it elsewhere far cheaper. It is a good long walk to get anywhere. Hotel did not have vending machines, so you need to bring snacks with you. Hotel was not worth the $142.00 per night we paid. It was nice, but didn't even have shuttle service. Treasure Island had a nice shuttle that was in use on weekends, for free. Next time, we stay in the middle of the strip so we don't have to walk, or take a taxi so far.
reviews.title: Inconvient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trump, as always, has great attention to detail. The suites (w/kitchenette) are elegantly decorated, the master bathroom is massive and even has a mini tv built into the mirror. Great place to go with your significant other if you're looking for a high-end luxurious place to be mellow at...there is no casino, no real pool scene and the lobby bar is pretty basic...
reviews.title: Beautiful suites, mellow pool scene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For a Vegas hotel with all the amenities minus the casino, the Trump offers the best value and the best in comfort! We were impressed with the quiet, the comfort and the cleanliness. Great pool, great food, great service! The only thing we didn't care for was the mandatory extra fee upon checkin for use of the pool, etc.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet and clean
Beautiful alternative to casino hotels
reviews.text: The Trump International Hotel and Tower Las Vegas is a great alternative to the strip casino hotels. It is steps away from the strip, directly across the street from Fashion show mall. Because it does not have a casino, it's quiet and serene. The rooms are well appointed with luxurious fixtures, furniture and linens. A no brainer for non-gamblers like us, but also a good choice for those who come to gamble but appreciate a little solitude during the down time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before arriving we had specified a quiet room on a high floor. We had also told them we were getting married.
reviews.title: Mixed review - excellent staff shame about the train!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival the receptionist tried to push a room upgrade - which although this was offered at a discount would have added considerably to our eleven night stay. When a customer says no thank you - please take them at their word. The last thing we expected on our first night was to be woken by the train especially on the 48th floor and I did wonder if we had been given this room because we had refused to upgrade. It was so bad we went down to reception in the middle of the night for an alternative room. Not what you expect after a 10 hour flight! The night manager John arrived eventually looking very dishevelled and transfered us to the 31st floor - this meant moving all our luggage down in one lift to the lobby to transfer to the lifts that serviced the lower floors. We were offered no assistance but at least we thought we may get some sleep. No chance the train was just as bad. At 5am we decided to go for a walk! At 8am I approached Andrew on reception to explain the problem - he arranged for us to be moved again as soon as the rooms had been cleaned. He at least had the foresight to keep us on a floor with the same lifts and moved us to room 3209 with the offer of assistance - peace at last. Throughout our stay Andrew greated us with a smile and was always very helpful.
reviews.title: Best value for money I've encountered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and well maintained,the kitchenette is very handy, the bathroom is bigger than some hotel rooms, the one thing I learnt moving from room to room and packing and unpacking three times is that there is not a consistent standard - robes, towels, mouthwash, bottled water, ice bucket, clothes hangers, crockery, glasses and bath room toiletries all differ. The maid service also varied even though we did leave a tip each day.
reviews.title: "Outstanding Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The minus points - the public corridoors and carpets need a good clean they are heavily stained. This could be because they allow dogs to stay - some of which are bad tempered, so enter and exit the lifts with care. The lifts are also tempermental so be prepared to get out and try again.
reviews.title: Trump Las Vegas - Excellent Hotel and Very Family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The plus points for this hotel are that it is smoke free and easy to get around. It smells lovely when you walk in. The walk through the shopping mall to the strip is probably quicker than some hotels have from room to lobby. If it is early and Nordstrom is closed walk up to the first level of the car park to access the centre to walk through to the strip. The hotel offers a courtesy bus to The Wyne and The Forum Shops although this is heavily utilised and is often full so do not rely on it if you are in a hurry. The H2O retaurant at the pool is excellent value and a great place for breakfast, lunch or a drink, The staff are great.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I personally found the recent Trip Advisor reviews “spot on” for Trump. I experienced a very pleasant first stay. Our early arrival was accommodated by Jamye S. who checked us in right away providing my requested room type, away from the train noise. Thank you Jamye, you really started my trip on a positive. The room was lovely, large and the bed extremely comfortable. I personally loved the jetted tub. I utilized the fitness center which opens at 6 am and found it to be a good facility. The elevators were quick and the room quiet. As anyone will see from viewing Trump’s website the rooms are equipped with a mini kitchen, which I found usefully, particularly the refrigerator, sink and coffee maker.
reviews.title: Not Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Housekeeping was great, actually all the staff was very accommodating and helpful except the bell desk. Interesting in that regard because I read criticism from other reviewers and did not use them to retrieve a car, but did request assistance with a luggage cart when checking out. After two phone calls and at least a 15 minute wait we moved the luggage ourselves. We had four pieces so a cart would have been helpful. I don’t know if the bell staff is so shorthanded due to mandatory valet parking, but this was the only staff I found totally lacking in service. I did not dine in the restaurant only because of similar poor reviews so I can’t address that.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would like to briefly address some concerns I have read. Trump is not far from the strip people, an easy walk. My goodness, if you walk through the huge casinos this is nothing distance wise in comparison. Also, the hotel has a complimentary shuttle that begins at 8 am and runs until midnight and goes to Wynn and the Forum shops. The shuttle to Wynn is very frequent, maybe every 10 – 15 minutes. Brooklyn “Billy” and all of the shuttle drivers were very nice. Also, if you wish to walk, go directly across the street and enter Nordstrom’s and walk through the mall to the cross walk over the Blvd. And yes there is a resort fee at Trump; most all hotels have a resort fee. I loved the fact that I did not have to experience a reservation with the standard line “subject to availability” when it comes to a NON smoking room, or a KING bed, these are standard at Trump and I loved it! No casino at Trump, no problem, there are hundreds in the immediate area. It was nice not having to snake through hundreds of slot machines and table games before reaching the elevator to your room. NO long lines at check in or special counters for card holders. Everyone is treated great.
reviews.title: Good value, no casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I consider consistency when reading reviews and found that Trump consistently receives positive reviews and that is precisely why I choose to stay. I am no new timer to Las Vegas and my past three prior stays have been at Wynn. I would like to point something out in that regard. Wynn is a lovely property, but there are a few really annoying petty things Wynn has that Trump does not, such as the fact Wynn does NOT have coffee makers in your room. Wynn also will not allow you to place a bottle of wine, water or a single thing in the honor bar refrigerator in the room, they now have a note on the refrigerator that you will be charged something like $25.00 a day if you use the fridge, oh and they also have the same resort fee as Trump. Wynn also is a smoking hotel and non-smoking rooms are request only as well as a king size bed is request only. Wynn has the thumping nightclub noise on the back side facing the golf course and Trump has the train noise facing the mountains, so room placement at both hotels is important if you are a light sleeper. No newspaper at Wynn either or jetted tub. Perhaps some of the rooms have those amenities, but the standard room does not.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay to visit Vegas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would recommend Trump if you have not stayed there before. I look forward to a future stay and hope you would consider it as well. I want to note a special thanks to housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: superb and incredibly welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Nice clean hotel. Should allow self and valet parking. Wait 39 minutes plus for getting valet car. Crowded and erratic loading and unloading. Might not be convenient to walk to strip at night. Friendly staff with excellent pool and gymn. Would not allow late check out unless you book through Trump.
reviews.title: Nice and chaotic valet parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel room is quite homey with microwave,refrigerator and mini stove. Bathroom with separate shower,toilet and tub. Mini tv embedded in Mirror while in tub.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Get a Quiet Room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Shuttles to limited hotels are available. One restaurant on site.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are nice and roomy, including the bathroom! We stayed at a studio suite, which had a fridge, a microwave, coffee maker and a stove top. As previous reviewers mentioned, the hotel is close to train tracks and you can hear the trains, but it was infrequent that it didn't bother me too much. But then again, no 5 star hotel guests should hear trains hollering at night.
reviews.title: super nice hotel accomidations and personel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My problem was the elevators. On my first night at the hotel, I barely got any sleep because it was very close to the elevators. It was like tying to sleep in a subway station! When I requested a quieter room the next morning, the friendly staff moved me to another one, which was really really quiet.
reviews.title: great value, no casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was very pleased with my stay at the Trump Las Vegas. The hotel is non-smoking and there is no casino inside, so you can escape from it all. The hotel offers complimentary late check out and shuttle to major hotels around the strip. This is the place to stay if you are staying in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Highly recommended- right across from it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at the Trump! This beautiful, classy hotel has no casino...that only adds to the peaceful atmosphere, like a quiet oasis in the midst of Las Vegas! Everything is first class here! The lobby is beautiful and luxurious and the front desk staff were welcoming ambassadors for a whole hotel staff who are friendly, helpful, and approachable.
reviews.title: Nice change of pace in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: We got a great deal on our room and it was amazing...so spacious you could "live there," somewhat like a first class studio. The bed was amazingly comfortable with fine linens, small kitchenette, lots of closet and storage space, and beautifully decorated like a home. The bathroom is on our list of top bathrooms on our travels. Very roomy, jacuzzi tub, separate shower stall (which could fit about 6 people!), separate toilet area, nice bath products, lots of storage, and even a TV!
reviews.title: Quiet Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had breakfast every morning at the bar in the restaurant area...the "breakfast pizza" is delicious and addicting...like a Benedict, but with smoked salmon and potato cakes...yum! I was a bit disappointed in the spa. Although it was a luxurious place with all the amenities, my pedicure felt rushed and the maintenence was not up to par...overflowing towel and garbage bins, untidy relaxation room. Hopefully these problems have been resolved!
reviews.title: first time in vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is a couple blocks off the Strip, but not too far to walk if you wanted. There are also convenient shuttles that will take you to the Wynn or Caesar's. It's also right across the street from the Fashion Show, which is a great place for shopping!
reviews.title: TV in the bathroom mirror!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed at the Trump International for one night. We booked through Hotwire so we didn't know for sure which property we would end up with. We were extremely happy with our experience. The check-in was seamless and very pleasant. We had their most basic room - studio with a city view. Everything in the room was high end and beautiful. It had a very modern, clean look that was very inviting. The kitchenette was great. It was really convenient to have the fridge and microwave. The bathroom has a huge jetted bathtub. It doesn't look very big until you get in it - very spacious with lots of room. The bed is very comfortable. There is a small living area with a pull-out couch that can accomodate additional guests. The weather wasn't very nice while we were there so we were not able to use the pool however, we saw the pool area and it is very nice. There are a few things that are included as part of the resort fee including valet parking (except for tips), free shuttle service that runs every 15 minutes (up until midnight) to Ceasar's Palace and Wynn, $25 spa credit and shoe shine service. We rented a car but we found that it was better to just take the shuttle into town. This property is about a 5 minute walk from the strip. We would highly recommend this property and will definitely keep Trump hotels in mind in the future. Just a side note - their website says they guarantee the lowest price if you book with them directly. I found a few websites (not including Hotwire) that were offering lower rates than booking directly.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay at the Trump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the views from the rooms were great....the condition of the hotel didn't meet the standards that I expected from a Trump named hotel. Or, maybe it did....lots of shine but lacking on the details.
reviews.title: Mixed Review...
Pretty good!
reviews.text: We choose to upgrade rooms when we arrived and got a corner one bedroom suite on a high floor. The views were spectacular and there was a lot of space in the room. We had a kitchenette which was nice. There was a little odd coffee maker that only takes these special one-use coffee baskets. If you want more than one cup you have to call housekeeping to bring you more refill baskets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our TV in the living room didn't work for two nights. Each time we had to call for serving. Each time they came to fix the TV....they gave us a free movie. Needless to say we got a bunch of movies for free.
reviews.title: Exceptional value. Spacious, quiet and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The carpets needed to be cleaned and had wrinkles. The workout room had enough equipment to workout and was mostly empty.
reviews.title: Even as guest you will feel like an owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in a corner suite at a good rate just before Christmas. The hotel is off the strip, but close enough and away from the noise and the endless guys trying to hand out cards for girls!! Our suite was enormous and luxurious. Huge well equiped bathroom with large tub next to a picture window. The suite also had a full kitchen with everything you could possibly want. Staff were efficient and friendly and everything went smoothly. Our later experience of a supposed top rated hotel on the Strip (simply awful) proved what a good hotel the Trump is.
reviews.title: Superb!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trump Hotel is located just off the main strip, within easy walking distance of many of the main casinos. The beauty of The Trump from my point of view is that it does not have a casino, so is realtively quiet - yet you have easy access to all the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas just minutes away.
reviews.title: Quiet Oasis just off The Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located opposite the Fashion Mall, and is close to many eateries and attractions. The rooms were large and practical, and the hotel was good value for money.
reviews.title: Smoke Free - Family Friendly - No Vagrants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found Trump Hotel (TH) on Priceline and booked the room over Christmas for $100 a night for a single room. My husband and I were happy to know the hotel is smoke free. If you are a smoker don't bother reading on because you CANNOT smoke in the building.
reviews.title: Nice stay, however...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were offered an upgraded to a one bedroom suite for an additional $50 a night, I wished we would have because I was told by some other guests that the suites are amazing. Our room was on the back side of the strip which faced the railroad tracks. We were on the 33rd floor and could hear the trains in our room on all 4 nights we stayed. This did not bother me; however, if you are a light sleeper you may want to upgrade your room to the other side of the building for an additional $25 a night.
reviews.title: Some things very nice, others not so nice.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Trump from December 31 through January 3. I was able to secure a great deal on the room through Priceline, and was extremely satisfied considering other lesser-quality hotels on the strip were charging double the amount of money for NYE in Las Vegas. Priceline makes no mention on their website about the $15 per day resort fee, but I already knew to expect it based on feedback here as well as the Trump website. Checking in was a breeze and we even got "Happy New Year" hats at the front desk. The entire staff was courteous during my stay, and the doormen were especially polite. Our room was on the 22nd floor offering a city view as opposed to the strip view...not too impressive but I was fine with it (the whole idea is to be on the strip, not watching it from your window). The room was immaculate and the bathroom was--as others have noted--absolutely amazing. I do wish, however, that the television in the bathroom had a guide, since the channels aren't the same as the television in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable and the kitchen was an excellent touch, though I must admit we did not use the appliances. All in all, the Trump is an amazing hotel, especially for those who want a quiet place to return to after those long Vegas nights. It is a bit of walking from the central strip (Bellagio, Caesars, etc) but it's a short cab ride and it was worth staying there as opposed to the Venetian which wanted $1400 for our trip dates.
reviews.title: Hotel was fabulous, just the right size!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in Dember 2009 and I would not stay at this hotel again for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Trump - You're Fired!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1. No self parking. Valet parking only which is free but still need to tip everytime.
reviews.title: Excellent except for a lapse in food quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Mandatory $15/day resort fee! Are you kidding me? It was freezing (frost) cold and the hotel does not have a resort. If they call their little pool a resort then they are out of their mind. This was even more annoying as I had pre-paid for my hotel room in advance through 3rd party company and the charge was suprise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for anyone traveling with a Pet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. THIS HOTEL IS NOT (LET ME REPEAT, IS NOT) on the Las Vagas Strip. You have to walk through a dark street (at night with no lights)with no sidewalk for a block and then you get to the Las Vagas BLVD. The walk is dangerous at night and you can get hit by cars and oncoming cabs. The hotel is located beside an empty construction land which is not at all pretty.
reviews.title: can't say it's a five-star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is "mere steps away from the strip". What it does not say is that it is a full block from the strip by way of a poorly lit, abandoned parking lot that does not even have a side walk in parts, forcing you to walk in traffic! It is definitely unsafe to walk by your self, even in the daytime.
reviews.title: A huge disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the website allows up to four adults in a room, they don't tell you that they must sleep on a pullout couch, with a thin, uncomfortable mattress. Therer are no roll away beds. The staff at the lounge pretty much ignored us. While others were sipping their drinks, it was not until we approached a waitress that we found out that the bar had been closed.
reviews.title: Luxurious room, customer service oriented staff, stupid resort fee!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Service was spotty. We had only one coffee cup the entire stay (although we had informed staff). There is a tea pot but no tea. One day we did not receive any hand wash cloths.
reviews.title: Great alternative in a quiet hotel in Las Vegas
Great Staff. Far from main attractions. Close to Clubs and Nice Bars.
reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful so if you want spend your entire vacation in bed, then this is the place for you! However, if you plan to go outside and see the sights and sounds of Las Vegas, I strongly recommend staying elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outstanding: The room...or should I say the 900 sqft one bedroom suite on the 36th floor. Contemporary decor with lots of marble, fluffy white towels and bathrobe, and a stunning view from floor to ceiling windows. Also the maid service was very accommodating, clean and quick.
reviews.title: Definately Trump! We'd be happy to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I'm a business traveler to Vegas, so being able to avoid huge, loud, smoky casinos is a big plus for me. this was my first stay at the Trump, but it won't be the last. Extremely cool design - lobby is lovely and the room I was in was great - big, well-done bathroom, a/c that really works, comfy bed, plenty of room to spread out and eat, work, watch tv, etc. The bell staff was worth a special mention - they were all extra-pleasant, hard-working (running around for cars when it's 104 is noooo fun) and service-oriented. The location was, for me, another plus - not right on the strip but very close to my customer's office and, for shoppers, literally right across the street from the Fashion Show mall. I didn't use the spa but will probably try it eventually. Just a nicely-done hotel.
reviews.title: Really like this hotel - great staff, no smoking, cool design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, and more importantly the rooms were GREAT! No gaming in the facility & there was only one choice for dining, but this did not make a difference to us.
reviews.title: Great Find, Would Stay Here Again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For business travel, this hotel can not be beat. Only a few minutes (a very short walk) off of the strip, so you are still close to great restaurants, shopping, etc..
reviews.title: Great Hotel with a few MAJOR flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The best part was the rooms. Very spacious. The entire property was extremelly clean & the bed was super comfortable. Sitting area & an unbeleivable bathroom.
reviews.title: Luxury Defined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Best place for the money!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely pathetic, I cannot believe Donald Trump put his name on this establishment. Holes in the towels, sheets and pillowcases. Broken tv. And to top it off their incompetent valet service scratched my brand NEW car right in front of me. I filed a report with security, no one ever contacted me. I have called almost everyday since, trying to reach someone that actually cares, I'm not holding my breath.
reviews.title: I would rather stay at a Ramada, you couldnt pay me to stay there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are wanting to walk into the lobby of your hotel and hear slow machines and see tons of people, this hotel is not for you. If you want to be far enough from the strip where you don't hear the drunk rowdiness but want to be close enough to walk and enjoy a little fun this place is great! It is a great 5 star hotel. I have stayed in the Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Hilton and more and I loved this hotel the most! Sometimes it is a little overpriced. But if you get it at the right times you can get these rooms for fairly cheap. We had a room on the top level that was just the standard and it was beyond amazing! The shower is separate from the tub. The tub is great if you are wanting to have a little bath time with someone special! Also in the middle of the mirror, it turns into a tv! It has two sinks which is very useful! So watch the news while you brush your teeth or a movie while you take a bath! Also every standard room comes with a kitchen. There is a stove and sink and everything! It is great! Truly a gem on the strip that me and my boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed! Also... Free valet!
reviews.title: Great 5 star hotel without the hustle and bustle of New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a touch of luxury and a bit different Vegas stay here. The hotel does not have a casino so you don't have an endless line of people trailing in and out of the property. I felt that it was a little bit my personal oasis away from the strip. The employees were the nicest I have ever experienced on the strip, from the room service attendant to the concierge and wait staff. The only person I wasn't impressed with was the gruff man at check-in, but he was still nice. This hotel had the fastest check-in I have ever experienced on the strip. And this was my 10th trip to Vegas. The rooms were awesome. I had a city view room, but the room was still amazing. The five piece bath was gorgeous. Large jet tub, 2 sinks, a hidden commode, large shower, as well as a TV imbedded into the mirror. My only beef here was that the beautiful floor would turn into an ice rink if you stepped on one drop of water so be very careful. They did have bath mats. The hair dryer sits in a bag on a shelf under the vanity. I even liked the makeup mirror. I felt that the flat screen TV could have been bigger, in the main room. The sitting area was so so comfortable. I was also expecting a more comfortable bed. Ours had a hump in it. It was a King though. The worst problem was that there was a train that would blow its whistle every few hours and a very tacky museum was beneath our window. You could also hear the highway. This hotel has limited eating facilities and is designed for your own cooking with a glass cooktop with two burners or a microwave. Room service is also available 24 hours. The restaurant is very good for breakfast but as expected expensive. You will not find the cheap buffet here. It is very easy to walk across the street to Fashion Show Mall for snacks and shopping and to reach the Treasure Island Hotel and Casino, or walk toward the east to experience the Encore and Wynn. We took taxi rides quite a bit and it averaged about $12 with tip. I seriously enjoyed getting away from the rat race of the strip and would stay here again. I did not check out the pool area, and there is quite a large pool and nice fitness facility. Room service was fast and the food was really good.
reviews.title: TRUMP MISSED IT BY AN INCH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is really nice. The reason people go to Vegas is for the experience and the hotels are an integral part of this. For this reason I wouldn't stay here because it's a bit out of the way and it's not going to give you that experience. If money is a huge issue and you don't care about the Vegas experience, go for it. The rooms were really nice and it was fun to get a view of Nevada instead of the strip, it kind of brings you back to reality. The only unfortunate thing was that the fire alarm went off at around 8am, we had just arrived and had to walk down 49 flights of stairs for no reason, false alarm. I don't even want to imagine how the party people felt about that. But that's not the hotel's fault really.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel but if you're going to Vegas for the Vegas experience don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Donald Trump, where are you? What are you thinking? You are putting your name on this?
reviews.title: NOT A 5 STAR!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend - just two nights. We went out to lunch on the second day, and left the Do Not Disturb sign lit. Upon our return, we noticed that the Housekeeping light was on. When we entered the room, a few items had been moved around (pillow placed on bed), trash was removed and that was it. Our used soap had been taken but not replaced. I called the front desk and explained to them that our room had been entered even though we had the DND disturb on. They apologized politely and said they would send up new soap and clean glasses right away. 20 minutes later, we heard nothing from them so we went downstairs to meet our friends at the pool as scheduled (left the DND sign on again). Upon returning to the room 45 minutes later, we found two new glasses sitting by the sink. I called the front desk again and received a return phone call from housekeeping who said they would investigate why people kept entering our room. We ended up carrying around all valuables for the remaining time we were there, and ended up checking out at 7 am just to get out of there. The room itself was lovely, and we were extremely pleased with our choice at first. However I will never return to this hotel. Luckily I left no valuables in the room the first time we went out. We heard nothing from the hotel after we made the first few calls to complain. If you choose to stay here for the comfortable rooms, please do not bring anything valuable, and expect that even on the 44th floor, there will be enough noise to make it sound like a full-blown club is next door. The valets were very nice, but that is the extent of polite service at this hotel. Everyone else was indifferent at best. If you're looking for your privacy to be respected, this is not the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Do not leave personal items in your room! 'Do not disturb' sign means nothing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good day Trippies,
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic... Bargain for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'm currently staying at the Trump. I have not left yet so I am writting this review while my memories are fresh.
reviews.title: You either will love it or hate it: We loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: The Trump far exceeded my expectations. We managed to get a room for $108 per night on priceline. I do think we could have done better but I really wanted this hotel and didn't want to spend days bidding to save a few bucks.
reviews.title: a very enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Trump certainly won't dissapoint at $108 a night. I have paid triple for bad rooms in Vegas.
reviews.title: Worst experience of our entire vacation; a total joke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 7 nights at the Trump Intl Hotel in a studio suite. The suite was elegantly appointed and very comfortable. Large, spotless rooms and huge luxurious bathroom. We enjoyed time by the pool every day - great service - busy on weekend. Nice breakfasts, quite reasonably priced. Driven to the airport by hotel's vehicle and received courteous service from all hotel staff. No casino was a plus for us as common areas were smoke-free and quiet. Fashion Show Mall was just across the road which was convenient. Charge for internet seems outrageous in this day and age however overall, this was a relaxing experience and we would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful, quiet, luxurious experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just got back from a quick escape to Las Vegas and thoroughly enjoyed my ONE-night stay with Trump. From start; the AMAZINGLY delicious and fresh scent through the entire hotel, friendly hotel staff, FABULOUS bathrooms with an exquisite jacuzzi tub, super plush bed, scrumptious and affordable room service, to the end.
reviews.title: Classy, Convenient & Smells so damn good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I only have a few minor complaints, the TV in my bathroom mirror did not work (the staff offered to fix it within the hour but I told them no worries), the 10 minute wait for the valet every time I got my car out and that damn train but it wasn't that big of a deal. Also, not quite sure why everyone complains about the location. It's seriously only like a 3-minute walk to Las Vegas Blvd which puts you right at the Wynn, Fashion Show Mall, Venetian & Treasure Island. And YES there ARE sidewalks!
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time I'm in Vegas I'd definitely check out the Trump again!
reviews.title: Dump The Trump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have just returned from my stay at the Trump Hotel which was extended due to the volcanic eruptions in Iceland for 1 week. This hotel is one of the best i have stayed in for value for money. We payed a very cheap rate compared to alot of places on and off the strip and this was money well spent and stretched. The room was large, bathroom was HUGE!! A jazuzzi tub with Jets, seperate toilet and large walk in shower. The only issue is the internet fee is ridiculous and also the resort fee as its not a resort. But apart from that i didnt experience any train noise for my weeks stay and the walk to the strip is less than 5 mins. The people that complained about that are extremely lazy!! Great Hotel, Great Value and Excellent Service!!!!
reviews.title: 5 star but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The night before we headed into Vegas, we hit up TA for reviews. All of the top rated hotels that we were familiar with had room rates running in the $300 range, so when we saw that we could get a suite at Trump for a little over $100, we were ALL IN! The idea of getting to stay in a totally non-smoking hotel with no casino was icing on the cake. Check in was a breeze and when we asked for a "very quiet room," the girl at the front desk put us in a corner room on the 46th floor. The room was gorgeous and my husband and I totally NEED a television in the bathroom mirror now. Room service was yummy and a surprisingly good value. We ended up staying an extra night and, like the title of the review says, we'll never stay anywhere else in Vegas again.
reviews.title: We'll never stay anywhere else in Vegas again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed ourselves on this 2 night stay at the Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas. It is located off the strip and near the north end of it. We could see down the strip from our room. The room was fabulous, huge bathroom with a TV, Jacuzzi tub, separate shower and a phone, along with a great living area. It was more than we expected especially for the price. Room service was excellent and so was the food they served. This hotel meets the high standards set by many of the resorts in Las Vegas. We also enjoyed the fact that we could get away from all the hustle bustle of the Blvd. I think a bus pass is a good idea. There is a shuttle service to Caesars and you can get up and down the strip from there on the bus. This hotel meets the high standards set by many of the resorts in Las Vegas. I would definitely return.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service- Par excellence. The room- perfectly fine , not my style but fine, lots of amenities in there, a kitchen, cutlery. The size of the room was huge to say the least. The room service was excellent. Very fast and responsive. Their staff were all very good and professional.
reviews.title: Great rooms and service, terrible parking, location and logistics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The cons---and this is big -- it is very cramped (public areas). There is no self parking, so valet takes 20-30 minutes to get your car everytime you need it. It is located off the strip, not on the strip directly so walking is a pain.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The vehicle circulation space in front of hotel is a joke.
reviews.title: 5 class hotel with 1st class service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really great modern condo. I chose the Trump as I did not want a hotel with a casino as I like to get away from the constant noise. This hotel had only been built a couple of years and the rooms reflected this clean and new. Pool on the roof was also great. Its gold from the outside so cant be missed. The hotel is located at the edge of the strip but there is a Nordstrom that you can walk through to get to the main area and is air conditioned environment which beats walking in 100*. Only down side is a lot of people were using prostitutes and I think our neighbour was doing the same which felt a little seedy as heard a lot of noise throughout the night.. Will go back though as fantastic value..
reviews.title: New hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A group of friends and I stayed at Trump and we could not have been more pleased with our stay! Everything was fab... The hotel was beautiful and the rooms are definitely the best that Las Vegas has to offer for what we were willing to pay. ($109 per night). I could have easily paid twice that and still felt like I got a great deal! We were able to go out and do "the Vegas thing" and come back to this "oasis in the desert" via their free shuttle service. No smoke, no drunks and no one trying to hand us an escort for hire nudie trading card. Mr. Trump out-did himself with this great hotel not to mention the employees at Trump are very courteous and accommodating. If you want a great vacation in a great city....go to Vegas and stay at the best hotel in town!!
reviews.title: The Trump is the place to be in Las Vegas!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked our room on Priceline, so we didnt actually choose Trump on purpose. However I am so glad we got it and I would stay here again without hesitation. We stayed here 3 nights. The first impression set the mood. The lobby is very elegant, classy and smells great and there is no casino so no smoke, no loud noises, no random people. Everyone was always more than eager to help. The doorman always opened the door with a "Good morning" or "Welcome Back". The valet was always prompt and courteous as well. We never waited more than 5 minutes for our car and our luggage was brought to our room immediatley. The woman who assisted in check in was very nice and helpful and of course offered the upgrade. We considered this even before we arrived (had read about it here) but in the heat of the moment we did something we hadnt planned...we upgraded to the 2 bedroom penthouse for one night.
