Sure it was a big splurge, but why not try something once. It was on the top floor, includes a foyer, 2 1/2 baths, full kitchen, living room, two bedrooms and amazing views. The master bathroom is AMAZING. There were alot of little perks such as spa products, slippers, toothbrush, sewing kits, etc. We ordered room service for dinner which was delivered in a timely manner. For the second and third nights they upgraded us from a regular room to a corner suite (I think as a "bonus" for staying in the penthouse the previous night). This room was just as nice as the penthouse except not as big. We probably would have been just as happy with this upgrade and saved on the penthouse. We had to call housekeeping for an extra blanket which arrived within 15 minutes. We also loved that the pool was quiet and relaxing. They even heat the water which is nice. Even though its very hot outside, swimming in freezing water is never fun. Loved there is no party atmosphere here. We had a excellent stay here. Everyone was pleasant and went out of their way to be professional and helpful. Having the location slightly off the strip was nice too. Made it seem even more upscale and not as "commercial". We walked across the street to Fashion Mall several times and found you can take shuttles/trams from hotel to hotel and eventually end up at the mall and then short walk to hotel. On a side note, we could hear the train even on the 64th floor but it wasnt a big deal - we can hear trains at home too. We did not eat at the restaurant so cant comment on that. Again, we would stay here in a minute!!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a studio suite for 4 nights at the Trump hotel in Vegas. Everything was top of the line -the room, the lobby and fitness gym. The pool was small but not too crowded. The staff was really nice. There's nothing bad that we can say about our stay. We would definitely stay there again!!
reviews.title: Nicely done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took 1 hour to get our luggage after several phone calls to the bell desk. The valet person that greeted us upon arrival was rude and impatient. The tv in the bathroom did not work (not really important but still). The tv in the bedroom was fuzzy and then the cable went out (second day was working). The pillowcases were missing and had to call housekeeping several times. After an hour my husband flagged down a housekeeper in the hallway who was kind enough to replace them for us. The room smelled like cigarette smoke and it is a non-smoking hotel. Enough said.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'm traveling with a baby, so I'm avoiding a big hotel with casino in the lobby mainly because of the noise and smoke. Trump Hotel don't have a noisy smoky casino, so this is perfect. Plus the room have a fridge and a mini kitchen that works perfectly to prepare food for the baby.
reviews.title: perfect for family with baby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I also love the bathroom. Big, spacious, with a mirror TV and jacuzzi tub. Very nice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved this hotel because of the large room, friendly service, nice workout facilities, and great pool lounge chairs.
reviews.title: What a disappointment the most important part of sleeping is the bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We thought we hit the mother load, until we arrived. There it started out with discrepencies at check in and finding out we are paying additional 16.80 per day for the pool and a 4oz. bottle of water per day. That included days that the pool was closed due to "wind".
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: It was scary walking past a old parking toll booth on the sidewalk converted to a sleeping box filled with belongings of a homeless person, the sidewalk filled with broken glass, trash and old clothes and tire littering the sidewalk. Real trashing area after dark, not to forget the extra distance off the strip to only this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice if you can get it for a discount

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This condo hotel should be in the top 10 of Las Vegas.We have been to Vegas about 7 times and this condo hotel is great.The room is nice and new and beautiful inside and out.The hotel staff will do what ever possible to make your stay nice.We were there for New Years Eve and it is in a great spot for that.It's a short easy and safe walk to the strip,right across from the Wynn.The mall is right there also which is nice.Vonns grocery is about 2 to 3 miles away which is nice because you have a kitchen.How many hotels will let you stay in your room if you have a late flight?We are going back.Get a strip view,it's probably more quiet,the mountain or city view has a train that passes close by and blows his whistle a couple of times,but it really didn't bother us.
reviews.title: Great New Years Eve Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is very nice - although i dont know that it rates 5 stars like it recieved on priceline. I dont usually stay at that level of hotel so i am not sure about the usual standards.
reviews.title: not worth it - there are much better choices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a mixed hotel/condo property and the rooms are all very large and have the kitchen in them.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there was a nice restaraunt on site, but i did not eat there.
reviews.title: Almost a Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bad- location -location-location (for me anyway)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel if you don't need to Gamble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I ended up at the Trump after a spin of the Priceline wheel. We could not have been more pleased. We stayed 2 nights in a standard room. They offered to upgrade us to a one br suite on check in, but we opted to stick with what we already had. I'm glad we did. The standard room ended up being quite large with a luxurious bath (whirlpool tub big enough for two), a sitting area with several pieces of furniture, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on, a kitchen-type area with toaster,fridge, micro, coffemaker,etc., and a fabulous view. Another plus for us is that the entire property is non-smoking. If you've been to Vegas you know that hotels with casinos come with an accompanying smell of cigarette smoke. The Trump has no casino. For some, this might be a deal breaker, but there are plenty of places to gamble quite near by. One thing to keep in mind is that they don't have self-parking, it's valet only. You will pay a $20/day resort fee that includes many things including in and out valet. As we had just paid almost $50/day to park at our hotel in San Fran I didn't find this out of line. All in all, a wonderful place to stay!
reviews.title: Awesome Anniversary Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Trump Hotel after seeing a special on travelzoo.com for $93/night. This was my very first time in Vegas and the hotel was amazing! I called in to the hotel and asked if it was possible to check in earlier than the scheduled 3pm check in. They said it was fine and I was checked in at 1pm and it only took 2minutes. The room was absolutely beautiful modern and clean. The first thing you notice upon walking in, is the nice clean smell of coconut and jasmine. The hotel smells amazing compared to the smoked filled casino hotels. I stayed on the 31st floor and all the rooms at the hotel are up to date and modern and luxurious. The room had all needed utilities, a blow dryer, iron, coffee and coffee maker and a very good working cold mini fridge. The bed is very comfortable its neither soft or hard. The mattress is medium firm with a pillow top. The sofa can also be converted into a sofa bed making more room for more guests. If your going to Vegas to shop, this is a great hotel. The fashion show mall is right across the street a few steps away from Nordstorms, Neiman Marcus etc. The staff was so incredibly nice and always in a good mood and very helpful. The shuttle is said to run every 30mins to Ceasars Palace, however whenever I came down the shuttle was ready and available to ride. This hotel is also a great choice to people with pets, I saw about 5 dogs walking through the lobby arriving and leaving. Overall, this a GREAT pick. Do not think its far from the strip. Not AT ALL! it takes a 5min to walk to the Wynn and on to the strip. This hotel is beautiful and a very good choice. Happy traveling.
reviews.title: The Best Helpful Review yet, Stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I spent 4 nights there for my recent Las Vegas trip. Everything was nice and the staff were friendly. They even gave me an upgrade to 48th floor. The view was excellent. *_*
reviews.title: Perfect choice if you dont like casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a meal at DJT restauant, the food was OK, but the service was excellent. Outdoor pool was also very nice.
reviews.title: great hotel,
Magnific hotel!
reviews.text: Ladies might like this, there is a huge shopping mall right in front of the hotel. You wont be worried about how to kill the time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a decent deal on Priceline for this hotel, for a recent three day trip to Vegas. However, watch out for extra charges! There is an additional $15 per room per day charge for valet parking (we didn't have a car) and use of the pool (didn't want to use it). The charge isn't optional however, so it's just a bit of a racket. The internet would have been an additional charge (didn't use it). Even though we got a good room rate, there weren't any affordable dining options here so we ended up going elsewhere as opposed to having $50 breakfasts. It would have been much more convenient to have a hotel with these kinds of facilities.
reviews.title: Nice, but not a 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is right directly on train tracks. At least on the "City View" side, you can vividly hear the train. We were on the 42nd floor. The trains woke us up 2-3 times per night. We live right on a busy 6-lane street at home, and yet the train was loud enough to wake even us up. To move to the other side of the hotel was going to be $25 per night extra (facing the strip instead of the city). In retrospect, it would have been worth it because of the train noise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - No Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms are so nice - great bathroom with a TV embedded in the mirror, huge tub, huge shower, just great. Comfy cushy beds too. The concierge was super helpful, and got us great tickets to Penn & Teller.
reviews.title: Poor location. . .Squeaky bed. . .Thin windows. . .But AWESOME bathroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A few quick notes:
reviews.title: Not quite 5 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - There isn't a casino at this hotel
reviews.title: expensive, not well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trump stood out from the other LV hotels 1) because there's no attached casino and, therefore, no cigarette smoke to address, which was important for us since my wife is pregnant. Additionally, 2) it's relatively quiet, providing a nice oasis from the chaos of the strip. Don't get me wrong: part of the reason people go to Vegas is for the madness, right? But staying at the Trump allowed for both lively fun among the masses AND relative tranquility by the pool with only maybe 50 people with you. While it's just a short walk to the strip, it's a bit far from a lot of the main hotels tourists frequent, and the shuttle to Caesar's Palace's Forum shops did not run on the hour as stated (more haphazard than that). Taxi's to the center of the strip were $8-14 depending on traffic.
reviews.title: Definitely more Pro's than Con's to being just off the strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service was exceptional and always friendly, and the breakfast buffet, while a bit pricey at $54 for two, was of supreme quality. We have no regrets staying there, and you won't either.
reviews.title: A delightful surprise and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a six night stay at Trump...and I was pleasantly surprised. The whole ambience of the hotel is very regal and luxe. It looks and feels a little over the top upon first look, but improves on closer inspection.
reviews.title: Well Done Mr Trump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my first time in Vegas, and I am so glad I chose the Trump International. Even though it is not on the Strip, it is only a quick walk to the Wynn on a road that was relatively busy with cars and a sidewalk for pedestrians. We even took the more 'scenic' route through the Fashion Show Mall a few times, which was directly across the road from the hotel. My friend and I walked the distance quite frequently, even in the 110 degree heat and were never concerned for our safety. It really is a quick walk, and there is a free shuttle that takes you to Caesar's Palace which is considered the middle of the Strip. Although the shuttle does not run past 10pm, and given this is Vegas we found that we couldn't make much use of the free shuttle given we were staying out a little later than that.
reviews.title: ONLY place to stay in Vegas
Excellent Choice
reviews.text: The staff seemed nice and helpful, although housekeeping was a little lax. Our room went unserviced for a day, and it was looking very likely we were going to go without housekeeping for a second day when we returned from the pool late in the afternoon to find the room still as it was. Luckily our housekeeper was in the next room, so we were able to catch her. When we told her that we would be leaving for a show in the next 30 minutes and perhaps she would prefer to come back then so we would not be in her way, she advised that her shift was ending at 5pm and could not come back. Whilst the bathroom was always immaculate after housekeeping, the bedroom was not. The side tables were quite dusty and one day we came back to find the ice bucket had not been emptied and was still full of water. On our last day, even though we had the 'do not disturb' light on, the housekeeper entered our room which we thought was a little inappropriate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas and I was quite impressed (as expected, being a Trump property). The hotel has good points and bad points, but more good than bad. First, if you are going to this hotel, you have to realize that there is no casino, which is unusual for Vegas since there are slot machines in the airport. You also have to realize that this hotel is not on the strip....it's about a block back. Now, this could be something you are looking for if you want to get away from the craziness that is the strip but if you like being right there in the heart of the action, then this hotel may not be what you're looking for. This is just a hotel, no bells and whistles like the other Vegas hotels, no casino, no shows, no fountains, no volcanoes erupting, but also none of the hustle and crowds either. And it's smoke-free. Plus, no "porn" vendors outside the hotel either. On the strip, you can't spit without hitting one of these sleaze-peddlers. Trump offers you solace from that. However, don't despair, the hotel has shuttle buses that will take you right to Caesar's Palace and the Wynn, so you are only moments away. If you don't want to wait for the shuttle, the strip is only a 2 or 3 minute walk away. The hotel itself is beautiful. Marble floors, brass (gold) light fixtures, the woodwork around the walls and in the elevator reminded me of the boardroom on The Apprentice. The pool was great with lots of seats, warm water, clean towels, a bar nearby. This hotel also has a wonderful aroma. I have no idea what flowery smell it is but I have never commented on how a hotel smells unless it's bad. But this smell was great. It greets you immediately as you enter the lobby. At check-in, we were also offered the chance to upgrade our room for $50 more a night, which we declined. Quite frankly, it really didn't matter because the room we did get was one of the largest and best laid out hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. We were a bit confused as we approached our room when we saw two room numbers on one door (are we sharing a room with someone?). However, the first simply opens to an entryway. The two separate room doors were on the inside. Quick note here......your room has a doorbell!! Seriously. The bathroom I can only describe as huge. Standing in the door, the tub was on our left and was big enough for my girlfriend and myself to both fit in. A double sink on the far wall with a giant mirror, featuring a TV in the mirror. Several nights, we "bubbled" in the tub with the water jets going and watched TV. To the right behind glass doors was the shower....a shower big enough for both of us to walk around in. The toilet was also behind another glass door. Out in the room, we had a nice view of the Rio hotel and we could see the Mirage off to the left. However, right down below us we could also see Industrial Blvd featuring the Love Boutique. I won't comment on that......you can fill in your own blanks. King size bed was fantastic, plenty of closet space, counter space, we even had a stove, sink, refridgerator, utensils, in case we felt like cooking anything (we didn't). In front of the large window on the far wall was a couch which opened into another bed. Desk space was great and we had free internet (well, not really free....Trump hits you with something called a "resort fee" for $19.95 a day. Your internet is included in that fee). We did not eat in the DJT restaurant in the hotel, as it seemed a bit pricey. Now for some bad things, one other reviewer mentioned a train whistle. I would second that notion. We could see the train tracks from our room and a train did come by a couple times a day and was loud. 19th floor and we could hear it. However, growing up in a big city, I'm used to trains so it didn't bother me. Just be aware, you WILL hear the train. The earliest it came through was about 8am, the latest was about 11:30pm. We moved one of the chairs in the room and found a stain under the chair. Again, really didn't care.....I wasn't planning on eating off the floor anyway and afterall it was under a chair. However one point did bother me.....emphasis on the word "point". I was standing at the window one morning looking out over Vegas and I stepped on a carpet nail that was poking up through the rug. It did draw blood. Trump might want to get that fixed. I also noticed another carpet nail poking up near the entrance to the bathroom. So, be careful if you're walking around in bare feet. With that aside, I would still say this was one of the better hotels I have ever stayed in. I would highly recommend it and would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Trump does it right, off the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it, loved it all...We walked into Trump International after a hetic trip across the USA and fell in love instantly with this hotel and we were only in the lobby...We were invited to upgrade for only another $50 dollars a night which we accepted and our king room turned into a master king room..When we entered our room, I was laughing hysterically as I have never ever had a room as luxourious as this one nor have I ever had a view as beautiful as the one I had....My partner was blown away even though he did tell me to stop with the laughter but I couldn't...We had a large lounge area, kitcnenette, two bathrooms with the master bathroom bigger than places I have stayed in previously and the bedroom and bed were bliss....
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We heard the train at 3am but this did not worry us at all as after all, this was Las Vegas and a train passing through is far better than having a rowdy bachelor party next door which I have previoulsy experienced in Vegas. If you want quiet, a retirement village might be a better option as Vegas is about lights, noise and people....Loved it so much, we are planning our next trip back next year....Thankyou to the wonderful staff and the lovely young lady at the buffet making omlettes to order ( all included in the $20 buffet price )
reviews.title: relaxing haven away from the madness of the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have told all who will listen since we came back home to Australia and I just wish I could be back there right now...At least I will no longer need to look around for accomodation as this one is locked into my favourites....
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, nice staff, but a few issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have just got back from vegas and absolutely love this hotel.it was mine and my now fiance's first time in vegas and we knew that we were going to a hotel with no casino and we're so glad we did!!!vegas is just as crazy as everyone tell's you before you go although nothing quite prepares you for what to expect. we are not gamblers-which is one reason we chose this hotel,it is definately one of the more classy hotels in my opinion yet is close enough to the strip if you are.the hotel offers a courtousy shuttle to the wynn (5mins walk) and to the forum shops at ceasars palace(20mins)which are really helpful at all times of day.its good that you can go in and out of the hotels in vegas just for some food or to have a look round,put a bet on-whatever but it was so nice to be able to go back to the quiet hotel bar after a hectic day on the strip and have a drink before going to get ready to party all night and come back and not have to fight your way thorough the smoke and crazy gamblers to get to your room!!!!the rooms are lovely,we had just the basic studio suite and it was more than what we expected(we have stopped in many 5* hotels and this one knocked spots off most of them.bathrooms are huge,all marble with separate toilet and shower rooms,jetted tub-amazing!fills up really quickly and is a must to soak your tired feet after a hard day walking down the strip.big in room safe,(big enough for a laptop). kitchen with all the amenities we needed at least but they only thing we used was the coffee and cups!!we didn't eat in the room but it had everything needed if you would like to have cooked.we had room service one night and a lovely lady brought it into the room and offered to set the table up for us-silverware and all!!! we said no as we were only eating pizza and meatballs but it was lovely for her to offer!!!nice touch we thought.don't worry there is nicer food on the room service menu-it was just what we fancied!!
reviews.title: Relaxed & very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed a Friday and Saturday night at the Trump. Loved that it did not have a casino and is smoke free. Nice suites.Restaurant and bar prices very reasonable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but train keeps you awake at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, a major minus was that the hotel sits right by train tracks and the first night I was woken 7 times by freight trains passing through and 2 times the following night.Even using ear plugs the trains are very loud! So returning home the first place I went was to my bed to have a nap!
reviews.title: 2nd time is not the charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry, won't be back due to poor location!
reviews.title: Luxury that lives up to the 5 Star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The first time I stayed at The Trump in January 2011 we had a 1 bdrm corner suite, and it was awesome. We had people over for drinks and appetizers, it was easy as we had cocktail glasses, martini shaker, plates, flatware, and other items in the very nice kitchen. There were robes in the closet, and everything was top notch. Well, went back this weekend and things have gone downhill. No robes, even though their literature states that they are in the room, in the kitchen there were hardly any utensils, we had two forks, one butter knife, and one spoon which we discovered when we brought gelato back to snack on late one night. We had to share the spoon. We had one salad plate and one dinner plate, thank goodness we didn't plan on having anyone over or to eat anything in the room. We called down to housekeeping and asked for extra pillows, they came with no pillowcases. We had to chase down the guy and he then brought us the cases. There was a nice holder next to the phone for paper and pen, it was empty. Never did get filled. We had washcloths the 1st day then they took them and didn't replace them the 2nd day, we never did get any again. Bizarre. No napkins with the coffee fixings, which made the washcloth deficit even more noticeable as we could have at least used them as napkins in a pinch. The concierge couldn't have seemed more bothered when I stopped by to tell her that things just weren't up to snuff in our room. She said "So, what? Do you want some robes?" Then she asked if I wanted to have the day manager call me. I told her that I was leaving for the morning but he could call me in the afternoon. Guess who never called? Overall it was a big letdown compared to my first stay, and I'm not sure if I will come back. I do have to say the the valets and the doormen are AWESOME - they are so friendly and couldn't be nicer. It's nice to have a non casino lobby, it is very serene and smells great when you walk in. They need to work on the housekeepers and the female concierege.
reviews.title: Really wanted to love the Trump, but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to the USA. We could not have picked a better place to stay. We had a one bedroom suite with strip view on the 63rd floor. The room was amazing! The best I have ever stayed in. Huge, modern and a really comfortable bed. It even had two bathrooms with a huge Jacuzzi tub. The view from the room was also amazing. We found the staff to be professional and attentive. It is valet parking only, but this is included in the resort fee. There is a happy hour between 5 and 7pm where its two for one drinks in the lounge, which we utilised by having a few of the superb cocktails. This hotel is quite different from the other big casino hotels in vegas. First off it does not have a casino! Second its very peaceful and tranquil which makes a nice change from the rest of the strip. The buffet breakfast is also excellent. Furthermore there is a free shuttle bus to Wyn and Ceasers Palace for when you want to venture out for the evening. Fashion show mall is located right next to the hotel, so this is a perfect place to stay if you are planning on shopping there. In summary an excellent hotel in all departments. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Good hotel off the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We drove to Las Vegas from LA so we were quite tired but as we arrived at the hotel, the valet greet us, and the doormen opened the gold doors into the clean, peacefully and beautifully decorated lobby. Check in was very quick, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and were swiftly moved into our room. However we heard the train run pass and called down. They were very gracious and kind in allowing us to change rooms even though it was on a lower floor.
reviews.title: REALLY GREAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very nice and good for families to stay in if you don't mind sleeping on the sofa bed which was actually kinda comfortable.
reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone wanting a great hotel!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and housekeeping were excellent and so kind.
reviews.title: Best in vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool though small was nice and had a great view.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel just off the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a nice change from the cigarette smelling lobbies and entrances of other hotels on the strip however got quite boring at night. The walk is not quite long though after walking up and down the strip does get quite tiring.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel,............but it did have one glaring omission !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the hotel thru Priceline.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have both good and bad comments about this hotel.
reviews.title: Mini suites for mini sheckles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trump Hotel has exceptional staff, great service, very nice lobby.
reviews.title: Spa was wonderful. Didn't stay in hotel but might next visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good and bad, depending on what you are looking for. There is no casino in the hotel, thus it is very quiet, which is great and relaxing, while all other hotels on the strip are all very busy and crowded. Trump is not exactly on the strip, if you do not drive, it takes a bit of a walk. If you drive, valet service is great, and the driveway is pretty wide, thus traffic (valet + cabs) goes by quickly, while other hotels are very crowded and congested. But since there is no casino, there is no self-park, valet is the only option and they charge you $15 +tax resort fee per night to cover the valet and two small bottles of water and access to the pool (pool is pretty small). Personally I do not think it worths the $ comparing to other strip hotels, and it is just a total rip-off if you do not drive. They also charge ~$12 per 24 hours of internet access.
reviews.title: Fab hotel - Would definately go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Trump is just next by the FashionShow Mall, which is great.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, shame about the loud train.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Let me get the bad out of the way first... the train noise is TERRIBLE (or was, at least, in our room - #5423). Perhaps we were put in a room directly above the train crossing/intersection because we booked via Priceline but, regardless, be SURE to request a room away from the train tracks!! I was awoken at 2:30 am, 3:30 am, 5 am, 6:30 am....
reviews.title: Nice hotel but... choooo choooooooooooooo!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I called the front desk tearfully requesting ear plugs & they said they had none but that the gift shop did. My next question: "is the gift shop open now" -- answer: "no" which meant/translation "you are S.O.L.". I am not joking when I say I considered sleeping on the bathroom floor to get some quiet rest.
reviews.title: Upscale rooms, quiet setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: The friendly & helpful staff did, however, move our room the next afternoon & I purchased ear plugs & then slept fine (but you don't really anticipate having to wear ear plugs in a 5 star hotel).
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not for family...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Anyhow, the train noise is bad. You have been warned.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, this is a fine hotel. I breathed a sigh of relief (literally) at it being smoke-free. I thought the hotel being casino-free might be a bit of a bummer but it wasn't.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, not amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel because we had stayed thee before in June. We went for my Birthday, and we had A wonderful time. The Hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spaceous, and had everything we needed in them, even a "safe" We enjoyed the service as well.. I aways hate when it is time to go home.. We also went shopping, which is right across from the Hotel.. I have told all my friends about this Hotel, and I will be returning again, and again, and again............Johnette from Bakersfield, CA.
reviews.title: Hotel lived up to the TRUMP NAME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Trump over Labor Day, booked through Priceline, had a great room on the 42nd floor. Large comfortable bed with a kitchenette (which went unused), HD TV, lounge area and a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and TV. The room was very clean though there is maid service only once a day, the staff was friendly and attentive, they got us great seats for Zumanity the same day. There is only valet parking which can take some time during the busy parts of the day and the pool area is packed, so go early if you want a good spot. Though the Trump is right across from Nordstrom and the Fashion Show Mall, it is a pretty good walk to the Strip, the Wynn is probably the closest casino to the Trump. I had no problems with the reported train noise, though my girlfriend said she heard it a few times. Also at checkout, they comped the resort fee and the internet fee for me so that was a nice surprise.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, well off the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was granted my 3 day Labor getaway to the Trump by way of Priceline. At first I was a little disappointed by some of the horrible reviews , but I figured I would make the best of the situation and approach this hotel with a clean perspective. My boyfriend and I arrived at 12pm , and we were greeted by courteous valet and bell men who immediately took our luggage and showed us to the front desk where we waited patiently on a line. Upon check in , we were upgraded to a suite with a view of the strip. The hotel lobby was immaculate , clean , and there were no riff raff hanging out. We checked into our lovely suite and went to the pool.
reviews.title: The Trump is an Excellent Hotel , Highly recommend for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool was an ultimate pleasure! It was Labor Day weekend , there was a good energy about the place , we were able to get a poolside couch with no problem , and the pool was perfect for just lounging. There was a super cool DJ playing very sexy carribean music which was well suited for the pool's atmosphere. We ended up getting trashed by the pitcher of mojitos that we ordered poolside , which was nice.
reviews.title: Ripp Off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In regards to getting in and out of the hotel and out to the strip, there was no problem. If we wanted a cab , there was one waiting for us. If we wanted to drive our own car, valet brought it within minutes. I truly do not see what the issue was for some travelers. I am not being overly generous on this hotel either. I've stayed at 5 start hotels all over the world in Hong Kong , Bangkok , New York , & Singapore. I would've liked it if they had more restuarant selections and flexibility in the hours of operation.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

description: Towering over The Las Vegas Strip, the Trump International Hotel™ - Las Vegas is a non-smoking luxury resort offering 1,232 graciously furnished hotel suites and 50 magnificent penthouses. Boasting the finest views of The Strip, the hotel lies where Las Vegas Blvd meets Fashion Show Drive, adjacent to the best shopping and finest casinos in the city. The Spa at Trump® offers 11,000 square feet of sumptuous serenity, ensuring that each guest’s experience is a memorable personal event.
